alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Choctaw and western Oktibbeha Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 126 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chester, or 18 miles north of Louisville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Reform around 130 PM CDT. Sherwood around 140 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Sturgis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near lakes, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Boats could be damaged or overturned in high winds and suddenly higher waves. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
